Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.11792701]Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=0.31-0.63 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC=0.31-0.63 µM);Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213 (MIC=0.31-0.63 µM), Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC=2.50-5.00 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.11792701]EC50=24.4 μM against human red blood cells.
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The peptide adopts a helix-hinge-helix structure in a membrane mimicking solvent. The hinge may play a role in allowing the amphipathic N-terminal helix and polar C-terminal helix to orient independently upon membrane binding, in order to achieve maximal antibacterial efficacy.(Ref.2)
Sequence Information.Function: Has antimicrobial activity. Has insecticidal and hemolytic activities. Probably acts by disturbing membrane Function

Literature.Title: Cupiennin 1, a new family of highly basic antimicrobial peptides in the venom of the spider Cupiennius salei (Ctenidae).
Literature.Author: Kuhn-Nentwig L, Muller J, Schaller J, Walz A, Dathe M, Nentwig W.

Literature.Title: Solution structure and interaction of cupiennin 1a, a spider venom peptide, with phospholipid bilayers.
Literature.Author: Pukala TL, Boland MP, Gehman JD, Kuhn-Nentwig L, Separovic F, Bowie JH.
